summary: Let’s talk some more about “The Hungry Caterpillar” and some Killing Eve thoughts. What I find interesting about 2x03 is the...
body:
Let’s talk some more about “The Hungry Caterpillar” and some Killing Eve thoughts.

What I find interesting about 2x03 is the shift that Eve’s marriage took. Yes, the marriage was dysfunctional from almost the start of season 1, so it’s definitely not surprising. Although, up to 2x02, Niko seemed to be a person that would always tolerate Eve’s actions. On 2x03 things change. 

We see Villanelle stalking Niko at his work, observing him like a lurking predator who’s waiting for the right moment to strike. Having in the back of our mind the parallel of Anna and Eve, and with Konstantin mentioning Anna at the beginning of the episode, we can’t not remember what Villanelle did to Anna’s husband. 

We don’t know what Villanelle is thinking while watching Niko. We can only assume, of course, that it’s not for good, but we can’t say for sure if she’s planning to kill him, or watching him out of curiosity, or for something else. Whatever the reason she is there, one thing is clear; Niko is unintentionally serving Villanelle an opportunity. Villanelle sees him with his coworker, Gemma, sees how she touches him and how he lets her. So, Villanelle decides to exploit it by advising Gemma on how to make Niko fall for her, because it seems easy and maybe “he just needs a little push”.

I personally don’t think that Villanelle was planning to kill Niko initially and now she won’t have a reason to. She probably thought about it, but Villanelle is not the same “naive” girl she was when she killed Anna’s husband. Back then, she believed that by killing Anna’s husband, she could finally have Anna all to herself, however things didn’t work out the way she wanted. 

Despite the parallels between them, Anna and Eve are very different. Anna was a dark character for sure, since she was having a sexual relationship with her student, but she wasn’t gonna accept the darkness. Whereas Eve has already taken a way darker path and Villanelle has witnessed it first hand. Villanelle wasn’t Anna’s first choice, but she is Eve’s. Villanelle is Eve’s driving force and everything Eve does revolves around her.

In 1x02, Eve said to Carolyn that she was looking into Villanelle’s murder cases for MONTHS, before she got the job. She chose her job (which is to find Villanelle) over Niko time after time. She went to Villanelle’s apartment, even though she was instructed to go home. She lays on her bed awake at night, beside her sleeping husband, thinking about Villanelle. She just can’t let the team rule out Villanelle from the investigations, although they’re now dealing with a new assassin and as Jess said “we don’t need [Villanelle] anymore”. Well, apparently, Eve needs her! And Villanelle will know that the next time she sees Eve and her cut lip. Proof that Eve used one of Villanelle’s “gifts” again.

Even if Eve doesn’t end her marriage, Niko won’t matter, because “his wife barely even notices him” and as Villanelle said herself, she knows Eve, she knows her better than anyone. Better than Niko ever could. At this point, he doesn’t even want to understand her anymore.

It’s also worth mentioning that Villanelle saw Eve and Niko’s encounter outside of the school, when Niko told Eve he doesn’t want her there and he left to go inside with Gemma. I don’t know if she heard the conversation (probably not), but she was just a few meters away observing the whole situation and when Eve was alone she immediately approached her in order to slip the lipstick into Eve’s bag.

I should wrap this up now. Villanelle has probably come to the conclusion that Eve’s marriage was already on the brink of its ending. And Konstantin’s line “You still have something worth having. Don’t let her [Villanelle] take it” is incorrect in so many ways. 1. There’s nothing worth having, that ship is sinking and is sinking fast, and 2. Eve is solely responsible for this, not Villanelle.

Let’s talk some more about “The Hungry Caterpillar” and some Killing Eve thoughts.

What I find interesting about 2x03 is the shift that Eve’s marriage took. Yes, the marriage was dysfunctional from almost the start of season 1, so it’s definitely not surprising. Although, up to 2x02, Niko seemed to be a person that would always tolerate Eve’s actions. On 2x03 things change. 

We see Villanelle stalking Niko at his work, observing him like a lurking predator who’s waiting for the right moment to strike. Having in the back of our mind the parallel of Anna and Eve, and with Konstantin mentioning Anna at the beginning of the episode, we can’t not remember what Villanelle did to Anna’s husband. 

We don’t know what Villanelle is thinking while watching Niko. We can only assume, of course, that it’s not for good, but we can’t say for sure if she’s planning to kill him, or watching him out of curiosity, or for something else. Whatever the reason she is there, one thing is clear; Niko is unintentionally serving Villanelle an opportunity. Villanelle sees him with his coworker, Gemma, sees how she touches him and how he lets her. So, Villanelle decides to exploit it by advising Gemma on how to make Niko fall for her, because it seems easy and maybe “he just needs a little push”.

I personally don’t think that Villanelle was planning to kill Niko initially and now she won’t have a reason to. She probably thought about it, but Villanelle is not the same “naive” girl she was when she killed Anna’s husband. Back then, she believed that by killing Anna’s husband, she could finally have Anna all to herself, however things didn’t work out the way she wanted. 

Despite the parallels between them, Anna and Eve are very different. Anna was a dark character for sure, since she was having a sexual relationship with her student, but she wasn’t gonna accept the darkness. Whereas Eve has already taken a way darker path and Villanelle has witnessed it first hand. Villanelle wasn’t Anna’s first choice, but she is Eve’s. Villanelle is Eve’s driving force and everything Eve does revolves around her.

In 1x02, Eve said to Carolyn that she was looking into Villanelle’s murder cases for MONTHS, before she got the job. She chose her job (which is to find Villanelle) over Niko time after time. She went to Villanelle’s apartment, even though she was instructed to go home. She lays on her bed awake at night, beside her sleeping husband, thinking about Villanelle. She just can’t let the team rule out Villanelle from the investigations, although they’re now dealing with a new assassin and as Jess said “we don’t need [Villanelle] anymore”. Well, apparently, Eve needs her! And Villanelle will know that the next time she sees Eve and her cut lip. Proof that Eve used one of Villanelle’s “gifts” again.

Even if Eve doesn’t end her marriage, Niko won’t matter, because “his wife barely even notices him” and as Villanelle said herself, she knows Eve, she knows her better than anyone. Better than Niko ever could. At this point, he doesn’t even want to understand her anymore.

It’s also worth mentioning that Villanelle saw Eve and Niko’s encounter outside of the school, when Niko told Eve he doesn’t want her there and he left to go inside with Gemma. I don’t know if she heard the conversation (probably not), but she was just a few meters away observing the whole situation and when Eve was alone she immediately approached her in order to slip the lipstick into Eve’s bag.

I should wrap this up now. Villanelle has probably come to the conclusion that Eve’s marriage was already on the brink of its ending. And Konstantin’s line “You still have something worth having. Don’t let her [Villanelle] take it” is incorrect in so many ways. 1. There’s nothing worth having, that ship is sinking and is sinking fast, and 2. Eve is solely responsible for this, not Villanelle.

blog.description: Welcome to dailyvillanelle! Your #1 source for all things Oksana Astankova (Villanelle) from the BBC America series Killing Eve and the actress who plays her, Jodie Comer. Tracked tags: #dailyvillanelle & #villanelleedit.

summary: #okay so we need to talk about this parallel and the contrasts because i’m just amazed #villanelle’s expression in the top gif...
caption: #okay so we need to talk about this parallel and the contrasts because i’m just amazed #villanelle’s expression in the top gif is so intimidating and predatory in a sense #this was their first meeting and it was all about one upping the other in some way #there weren’t any genuine feelings attached (yet) outside of lust maybe (on villanelle’s end) and it was really all about control between them and who had more of it #but now?? in the bottom gif?? #there’s nothing but complete vulnerability on villanelle’s face #she legit looks nervous and overwhelmed to even be in eve’s presence (and this is all while eve is unaware that villanelle is even behind her) #now there’s intense feelings involved and its so crystal clear #i could go more indepth but basically you see the shift and its just truly fascinating to me

summary: Tony: [to Peter] Never go behind my back again. Ever. You're by no means the only person I work with, but you take up a...

blog.description: a killing eve/phoebe waller-bridge projects & sandra oh sideblog | not spoiler free (tagged as #ke spoilers) | follows from imcaughtupinyou | sidebar gif by bargalaxies

summary:
**possible spoilers & speculation**
I’ve been wary of an Eve/Hugo hookup/sex scene since the beginning. It kinda feels like...
body:
**possible spoilers & speculation**

I’ve been wary of an Eve/Hugo hookup/sex scene since the beginning. It kinda feels like they’re setting something up there, with the strong dislike Eve has for him. I don’t ship it but I also feel like it’s inevitable? Something’s going to happen with Niko and the other teacher, and Eve is going to feel like she needs to get back at him somehow. That’s my guess at least! She’s gonna feel like she needs to break out of her mold, get some tension out. It won’t be serious.

edit: I don’t have any sources! this is purely speculation, I saw a couple of other posts in the tag and wanted to share my thoughts too!

reblog.comment:
**possible spoilers & speculation**

I’ve been wary of an Eve/Hugo hookup/sex scene since the beginning. It kinda feels like they’re setting something up there, with the strong dislike Eve has for him. I don’t ship it but I also feel like it’s inevitable? Something’s going to happen with Niko and the other teacher, and Eve is going to feel like she needs to get back at him somehow. That’s my guess at least! She’s gonna feel like she needs to break out of her mold, get some tension out. It won’t be serious.

edit: I don’t have any sources! this is purely speculation, I saw a couple of other posts in the tag and wanted to share my thoughts too!

blog.name: villanelleismyeviltwin
blog.title: Killing Eve is My Obsession
blog.description: Villaneve obsess with each other. I’m obsessed with them, especially Villanelle. She is my evil twin and I love her to the moon and back! Everything on this show is fucking genius! So, this blog is dedicated to anything related to Killing Eve, Jodie Comer, and Sandra Oh only — not multi-fandom. If you’re looking for Killing Eve stuff, just get on board. I make gifsets when I have free time. Visit My Site if you'd like. I do some shitty stuff there LOL!
